attributes.action: Laser hair removal free on the NHS for women with polycystic ovaries (PCOS)
attributes.background: PCOS causes a higher level of testosterone in females leading to increased bodily hair, which has been linked to mental health problems. Laser hair removal is free on the NHS for trans women because of their gender dysphoria and should be free for women with PCOS throughout England.

attributes.action: I think that children yr 7-9 should be able to have a 2.5 day weekend
attributes.background: In secondary school, children face much stress from h/w, changes in their life (physically and emotionally) and having the extra half day (finishing school at 12:00) would help so much. Children in yrs 7-9 need to be active and have fun and study at the same time- and I believe I have the solution.
attributes.additional_details: It is proven that children 13-19 (secondary school children) are the age group who take their lives the most and it is also proven that most of the time this is because of bullying or STRESS. With my petition I believe that the extra half day would allow children to have fun and work to high enough standerds. This is mostly aimed at 11-14/15 yr olds. The extra half a day also allows children to be active and another major rising problem is obesity which my solution can also conquer. This is also good for the teachers, who will have more time to work for better results Thank you.

attributes.action: School needs to finish earlier and start later
attributes.background: I spend most of my day in school. I would love it if school would start later and finish earlier, as when I wake up for school I’m so tired. I don’t think this is fair. We have one life, let’s live it.

attributes.action: Change the 9-1 grading system back to the ABCD system.
attributes.background: With the changing of the grading systems it has caused a lot of confusion in the education department. We, as students, often ask our teachers to explain the system. Some teachers can’t explain because they have no idea why the grading system changed in the first place and they don’t understand it.
attributes.additional_details: When parents ask about student’s grades they’re always confused and ask for the ABCD equivalent anyway. Why do we have to translate our own grades? If we say we’ve got a grade 7, for example, the response is always “Is that good?” There has been far too much pressure and stress put on students and teachers over these past couple of years and the changing of the grading system is useless! What’s the point in having 9-1 when we are always going to ask what the ABCD equivalent is anyway?

attributes.action: Mandatory minimum life sentence for rape
attributes.background: In 2003 its estimated there were 50,000 rapes every year. 600 sent to jail on average. If this isn’t ridiculous then.. There will be no change if we don’t start by helping the people in the world. Victims have a life sentence, so should the perpetrators.
attributes.additional_details: Raping someone is as bad as killing someone, because no one recovers from that. There is not enough justice for victims. Rapists do time and then are back out in the world to do it again. This needs to change and this is a start.

attributes.action: Give people who are partially sighted medical exemption certificates for lenses.
attributes.background: When I was 6 months old I was diagnosed with cataracts, I had both natural lenses removed, registering me partially sighted. This left me having to wear very strong lenses, -18 prescription. Without lenses I would be unable to see, to be able to see I have to pay £100 each year for the privilege.
attributes.additional_details: In the UK some medical conditions are eligible for a 'medical exemption certificate' which means that they do not need to pay for the day to day treatment of their condition. One of the criteria which will make you eligible is having "a continuing physical disability which means you cannot go out without the help of another person"(NHS website). Without my lenses I would struggle to live my life the way I do now, it would limit what I could do inside and outside the house. It is not a choice.

attributes.action: Make the running of a stationary car in any car park, public or private illegal.
attributes.background: It is currently illegal to sit in your car whilst keeping the engine running on a public road. This law needs to be extended to any car park, public or private or on a private drive in order to protect children and the environment from harmful emissions.
attributes.additional_details: For example, people leaving their engines running in school car parks may be exposing children to harmful emissions. Whilst schools may be proactive in trying to get people to stop these behaviours to protect children from harmful emissions, the law currently only states that it is illegal to run your engine on a public road. I want the law extended to both private and public car parks.

attributes.action: All primary schools to have a 20mph zone set within 1/4 mile
attributes.background: Local authorities should be required by law to set a 20 mph zone near primary schools. It is safer to cross a road with children when the speed limit is 20mph.

attributes.action: Add hot spices to the list of recognised allergens
attributes.background: Many people and businesses don't realise the damage done when someone with spice intolerance eats food that may only contain a mild/medium amount of heat. Crohns, IBD and Colitis sufferers may get  digestive upsets, severe pain, intestinal bleeding and need specialist treatment to calm the effects.
attributes.additional_details: Spice is all too often hidden especially in restaurants where inappropriate levels of spice heat can ruin a whole meal. I have had multiple occasions where a member of staff will assure us that there is no spice in a dish and when it arrives it is necessary to send the food back. Supermarket packaging the ingredients listed as 'spices' (on many foods it cannot be avoided) can hide items which will cause serious effects.

attributes.action: Ban sugar in Leisure Centres, Hospitals & all other places that promote health.
attributes.background: The government is not doing enough to tackle obesity so, in places that are meant to be promoting health, a total ban on sugared products would quite simply just make sense. Being able to buy a chocolate bar and fully sugared drink in a gym is a total contradiction of its purpose.
attributes.additional_details: Sugar is the number 1 cause of children being admitted to hospital in the U.K. for oral problems. Type 2 diabetes has never been so abundant. High street stores are having to change their sizing criteria. Education is the most powerful tool in which you can change the world but when no one is properly educating and no one is properly listening, removing choice is the only way to get proper results.

attributes.action: Make a governmental apology for the massacre at Jalianwala Bagh (Amritsar 1919)
attributes.background: April 2019 will mark 100 Years since the bloody Vaisakhi of 1919 when a massacre was carried against the people of Punjab in which several hundreds at least lost their lives. We must never forget the tyranny of the 'Butcher of Amritsar' General Reginald Dyer.

attributes.action: Introduce a regulatory body for the recruitment industry
attributes.background: A regulatory body should be introduced to ensure recruiters play fair with all parties.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election in April 2019.
attributes.background: The UK populace deserves to have a people’s vote, on which UK Party, will lead us into the future. After we leave the European Union. Give people a choice on what party will take over after 29th March 2019.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that the Conservative Party, should allow this. As they have made a bit of a catastrophe out of this whole Brexit ordeal. They owe us that much. Please allow an April 2019 - UK General Election.

attributes.action: Propose that the European Union be disband.
attributes.background: Greece is bankrupt, Italy is bankrupt, Spain, Cyprus and now France are all on the brink on bankruptcy. Why do people want us to remain when we are going lose all money within a couple of months.
attributes.additional_details:
http://blogs.lse.ac.uk/europpblog/2012/06/18/abandon-eu/ 
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/may/26/danger-brexit-break-up-eu-europe-russia 
https://www.debate.org/opinions/should-the-european-union-be-dissolved

attributes.action: Review racially discriminatory Gang Matrix(ces) obedience to human rights laws.
attributes.background: The Gang Matrix launched by Trident Gang Command is a system that has been found to disproportionately target BAME young men in their relation, or lack thereof, to gang crime. Information is often shared with other authorities limiting their access to opportunities and their chances of success.
attributes.additional_details:
The Metropolitan Police Service Gangs Violence Matrix and other similar Matrices should be dismantled, unless police services can demonstrate that they have been brought in line with international human rights law, in particular, the right to non-discrimination, privacy and family life, as contained in international human rights law. 
For further details read the recommendations highlighted in Amnesty International report: https://www.amnesty.org.uk/files/reports/Trapped%20in%20the%20Matrix%20Amnesty%20report.pdf

attributes.action: Transition the United Kingdom into a federation of constitutional republics
attributes.background: Abolish the monarchy and reform the United kingdom into a federation of constitutional republics

attributes.action: Invest in developing a hyperloop system instead of HS2
attributes.background: HS2 (high speed train 2) and train lines could become outdated technology. A hyper-loop uses a partially evacuated pipeline with the carriage moving on a maglev (magnetic levitation) within.
attributes.additional_details:
It could be much faster and, I believe, safer, cheaper, quieter and better for the environment than trains and aeroplanes. A fully developed and implemented hyper-loop could be far more cost effective and have many more benefits than a train line or indeed aeroplanes. Hyper-loops could allow people and goods to travel at speeds similar to a jet aeroplane with fewer costs, risks and inconvenience. Various worldwide companies are already starting to build hyperloop prototypes. 

The UK should be at the forefront of this development. It would be a great step forward in the connectivity of people and business nationally and would greatly benefit the whole country. The money would be much better spent than on unpopular and older technology such as HS2.

attributes.action: Require schools to buy text books made from recycled materials.
attributes.background: In school, we have been looking at deforestation and the causes and impacts of it. As an individual I have realized that a major issue for deforestation is the need for paper and other school supplies. Instead of cutting down more trees we should use recycled materials to help the environment!
attributes.additional_details: Each year, globally, we are losing 18.7 million acres of forests. Due to this we are left with only 3000 wild tigers across the world. It has been shown that the amazon rain-forest has lost 17% of its trees in the past 50 years, due to forest conversion. In addition, it is shown that trees are our carbon sinks, therefore proving that they inhale the carbon we cant. If they cant inhale this carbon it will be let off into the atmosphere. 15% of all greenhouse gases are due to deforestation.

attributes.action: Take diplomatic action against China for not respecting Hong Kong agreement
attributes.background: In 1997, Britain handed over Hong Kong back to China, this then was agreed that for 50 years after the deal was signed (1997) it would be a one country two systems policy. However, China is un-democratic and not respecting this agreement.
attributes.additional_details: New political parties and activist groups within Hong Kong have appeared recently with the British Hong Kong flag being taken to protests many times. The people are suffering and the 'so called' autonomous government even blocked a UK human rights activist from entering Hong Kong in October 2017. Also, a Hong Kong newspaper did a survey about Hong Kong independence and claimed that 92% voted they wanted to be British. The deal was supposed to stay in action until 2047 and is set in UN but no.

attributes.action: Force Rail Ticketing to allow for WFH and Auto Delay/Cancellation Repayments
attributes.background:
Our Rail ticketing is clearly out of date and the rail companies are failing 
1) Automatic Repayments should be mandatory for Delays and Cancellations 
2)With occasional Working From Home, tickets should be for a number of days usage not a calendar month or year
attributes.additional_details: The last few year rail travel has been appalling, Southern started a scheme to automatically refund for delays, South Western Railway have stopped this without filling in forms needing completion. They have our details linked to the ticket, this should be an automatic process. Our ticketing is out of date and the rail companies are frankly failing.

attributes.action: £85,000 turnover to remain non-taxable after becoming VAT registered.
attributes.background: For small businesses to grow allow taking of £85,000 (VAT threshold) to be non-taxable and exempt from VAT. Only make business pay 20% VAT on takings which exceed the threshold and not on the total taxable turnover. Currently becoming VAT registered as a small business is financially crippling.

attributes.action: Say NO to meat tax
attributes.background: Do not consider imposing additional taxes on meat products. Introducing a product specific tax will only serve to penalise the poor. Instead of reducing consumer choices, it would be more beneficial to educate the public about the impact on their health and environment.
attributes.additional_details:
There are examples in the past which show that these sorts of taxes are just another way of extracting more money from the public. Rarely do they have the full desired effect on consumption.
Furthermore, meat is not the leading cause of heart disease or global warming, thus it would make more sense to target those sectors.

attributes.action: Ban Blockchain Mining in the UK
attributes.background: The mining of cryptocurrency such as bitcoin is responsible for the output of enormous amounts of carbon dioxide emissions, the effects of which could cause substantial damage to the environment and contribute to global warming, rising sea levels and more unpredictable extreme weather.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/jan/17/bitcoin-electricity-usage-huge-climate-cryptocurrency

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/10/29/bitcoin-may-cause-catastrophic-climate-change-2033-study-warns/

attributes.action: Post-Study Work Visa for International Students after completion of Course.
attributes.background: IISAU on behalf of all International students studying in the UK appeals to reintroduce post-study work visa for international students after completion of the degree program.
attributes.additional_details: Indian International students and Alumni Union is raising the voice for all International students in UK. The Migration Advisory Committee recommended an automatic period of leave to remain after studies complete. A post-study work visa would make the UK a more attractive destination for international students and graduates, enabling it to compete with other popular destinations such as the United States, Australia, and Canada who have more welcoming student visa policies.

attributes.action: Fund a campaign to promote the use of biodegradable hemp packaging
attributes.background: Plastic is fast becoming a problem that humans have caused. Damaging our oceans, infecting sea life and ourselves whilst polluting our planet on a worrying scale. We need to act fast and greatly reduce the amount of plastic being produced. We need to switch to a bio degradable alternative, hemp.
attributes.additional_details:
It is estimated that over 12 tonnes of plastic ends up in our oceans each year. 
The plastic is appearing all over the planet, from beaches here in the U.K. To uninhabited islands in the Pacific. Not only is it choking sealife but it has become part of the food chain eventually ending up on our plate. A biodegradable alternative like Hemp plastic would stop this poison destroying our oceans and our planet.

attributes.action: Require all Staffordshire bull terriers to be muzzled & leashed when in public.
attributes.background: Legislation is required to combat attacks by Staffordshire bull terriers.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation is required to combat attacks by Staffordshire bull terriers. Dog chipping has not resulted in any reduction in dangerous dog attacks as claimed by politicians prior to the introduction of that legislation.

attributes.action: Get rid of metric measures and weights, bring back Imperial measures and weights
attributes.background: Fed up of metres or litres,  when we leave the EU,  we don't need them anymore, let's go back to what we knew as kids.

attributes.action: Sensory Therapy to be offered in all areas
attributes.background:
My son has been denied sensory therapy recently, due to it not being commissioned in our area. This is due to there not being enough research to prove it's needed. 
My child, along with thousands of others need sensory therapy just as much as everyone needs access to a GP. 

This needs to change
attributes.additional_details:
I have written to the commisioners but had no joy, therefore I have taken this to the parliamentary ombudsman and I want to get as many signatures as possible to support my case and get our voices heard. 

Please sign. It takes 2 minutes but could help children for a lifetime.

attributes.action: Limit domestic construction working hours
attributes.background: (The Ctrl of Pollution Act 1974 gives Env Health powers to control noise on construction & demolition sites.Permitted hrs of work when noise can be audible at a construction site boundary:Mon-Fri 8am-6pm Sat 8am-1pm) Domestically a neighbour can drill,bang on an adjoining wall all night,no law
attributes.additional_details:
I want to make the law apply to domestic construction noise pollution, it shouldn't just apply to construction sites.  This should apply to disturbing noise domestically.  I have had to endure (for a year so far) drilling & banging up until 11pm, all day Sunday at times.
When your sleep and peace is impacted it causes real stress.The police informed me that my neighbour can drill & bang on my adjoining wall all night, there is no law.  This surely just isn't healthy

attributes.action: Add electric pet containment systems (‘invisible fences’) to the e-collar ban.
attributes.background:
The recent e-collar ban is fundamentally flawed in still permitting use of electric containment systems which make similar use of the fear- and pain-based so-called ‘training aid’. 
‘Invisible fences’ inflict the same aversive stimulus on pets, scientifically proven to negatively affect welfare.

attributes.action: Urge Bank of England to return to traditional 'paper' banknotes
attributes.background: Keep existing 'paper* £20 & £50 and recall existing polymer notes. The public prefer beautiful 'paper' banknotes.
attributes.additional_details:
*Paper money: Traditionally manufactured textile-mix notes of folding currency; such as the US Dollar (75% cotton 25% linen). {as compared to polymer i.e. plastic notes - introduced to UK circulation Sep' 2016}

Polymer banknotes are not worthy of the dignity of a national currency.
Slippery to the touch and handle.
Prone to flying out of control, e.g. from wallet or the hand.
Unpredictably stick together. 
Will not fold or stay folded, to store easily in
wallets/pockets etc.
Don't sit securely within cash-till draws.
Difficult to count up - on a table the notes will not stack up, they slide away in disorder and bounce about.
Alternative security features are available to make 'paper'-notes as secure.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum for devolution in the North of England.
attributes.background: In 2004 the North East of England had a devolution referendum. Due to the small turnout the same referendum for the North West of England was never held. It is the opinion of many that the socio-economic divide between the North and the South of England has grown exponentially over the past decade.
attributes.additional_details: With growing cases of the North not having their issues and needs fairly addressed in the Southern biased Parliament, it is time that a referendum is held to offer those citizens North of the River Trent an opportunity to vote on devolution. This will provide a platform for issues relevant to the North of England to be considered without an underlying London-centricity.

attributes.action: Ban the use of horses within the police force
attributes.background: We want to ban the use of horses within the police force. Often the horses are put into dangerous and uncontrolled situations such as football games or marches which leads to distress for the animal. The horse is being exploited and is not having the freedom which we have and take for granted.
attributes.additional_details: I recently witnessed a Police horse struggling to walk, looking in pain along with acting distressed as it walked down a busy main road in Manchester. It is unfair and there are other means the Police could have used such as bikes, as this was a quiet Wednesday evening there was no need to have the horse out. The policeofficer was not able to control the situation in a calm & effective manner to which the horse would be taken out of the dangerous situation for both the horse and the public.

attributes.action: Appeal for the UN to ban Lethal Autonomous Weapons
attributes.background: Countries across the world are on the verge to finish artificially intelligent weapons by 2019. These machines will result in unfathomable consequences that humans cannot foresee. International legislation must be pressured by the UK to keep up to date before the technology is finished and utilised.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lethal_autonomous_weapon

https://autonomousweapons.org

https://futureoflife.org/2018/04/30/lethal-autonomous-weapons-an-update-from-the-united-nations/?cn-reloaded=1

https://www.janes.com/article/79311/china-s-shock-call-for-ban-on-lethal-autonomous-weapon-systems

attributes.action: Fund Sign Language courses for Hearing Impaired/Deaf adults.
attributes.background: British Sign Language can be taught to hearing impaired/deaf children free of charge but not adults who are suffering. I have always struggled with my hearing since I was a child but was not diagnosed until I was 18, at which point it was too late to learn Sign Language without paying for it.
attributes.additional_details: My type of hearing impairment means that one day I will be completely deaf and will not be able to communicate properly with family members. I have tried researching the Sign Language courses and they are expensive and have no free courses offered to those who are hearing impaired or deaf. I have even emailed plenty of Sign Language teachers to ask if there are discounts given to the hearing impaired/deaf to which they said no, and I personally believe that this needs to be changed.

attributes.action: Personal Tax Bills to show % contribution to Public Sector pensions
attributes.background: Performance of the Public Sector workforce underpins the efficiency and success of the UK. Public Sector funding (pay and pensions) is the greatest financial burden being carried by existing and future generations. It is timely and sensible to be more transparent with these costs.
attributes.additional_details: Public Finance magazine, MP’s and Local Authorities continue to voice their concerns over these costs. Some say they are overbearing, some say 30%+ of homeowners’ Council Tax goes to fund the Local Authority Pension Scheme. Unions say they will fight to protect members’ benefits. A House of Commons Report says Private Sector pay is about 80% approx of Public Sector pay. Personal tax bills should set out the individual taxpayer’s commitment to Public Sector pay.

attributes.action: calculate total suicides after involuntary discharge from mental health teams.
attributes.background: for the government to immediately provide a total head count on the number of suicides of people who have taken their lives in the 12 month period following being involuntarily discharged from nhs mental health teams.
attributes.additional_details: a combination of continual resource- stripping and outdated, harmful attitudes towards mental health is risking lives, which is why I am asking the government to urgently investigate.

attributes.action: Allow full-time second degree STEM students to access SLC tuition loans
attributes.background: Student finance provide funding for your first degree in full time study and then provide funding for part time study in STEM subjects for your second degree.
attributes.additional_details:
That doesn't apply for other way around, studying part time first for first degree and full time for your second degree in a STEM subject. It is unfair!! 

Students who do their first degree part time, through distance learning but then realise it is not for them cannot get funding to go to brick and mortar university to study full time. You can do it other way round though! Unfair!

attributes.action: Mandatory motorway driving tuition for all learners.
attributes.background:
Driving tuition is currently only carried out in towns and cities, reverse parking and 3 point turns are all well and good but it is time all learners were instructed to drive safely on motorways.
Motorway driving is completely different to urban and city driving, lets all make them a safer place.

attributes.action: Keep May 4th 2020 as a bank holiday
attributes.background: Ministers are poised to move the May Day bank holiday next year so that it falls on Friday, May 8 — the 75th anniversary of Germany’s unconditional surrender in Europe.Greg Clark, the business secretary, is reported to have asked the chancellor for permission to move the date from Monday, May 4th.
attributes.additional_details: VE Day marked the formal acceptance by the Allies of Nazi Germany’s unconditional surrender in the Second World War. The Trades Union Congress  called for the 75th anniversary to be given a separate bank holiday. Although the origins of the May Day holiday are thought to lie in a Roman festival to mark the start of summer, in modern times the bank holiday has celebrated the struggle for workers’ rights.

attributes.action: GCSEs to be replaced by a mix of academic and vocational subjects at A-levels.
attributes.background: I have been a secondary teacher for many years and I think the current GCSEs belong to an era when young people left education at 16. Let's have a baccalaureate system to replace A-levels, with a mix of arts, sciences and vocational subjects and exams at the age of 18.

attributes.action: Require coffee shops to charge more for disposables
attributes.background:
In a time where climate change and pollution are major issues we face, we still throw away 7 million coffee cups per day.

A change in the law should be made to make coffee shops be required to charge the same price, or greater prices, than eating or drinking in, for disposable cups and wrappers.
attributes.additional_details:
A petition like this could encourage people to buy food or drinks in reusable containers, rather than take the cheaper option of buying a throwaway cup.

https://www.independent.co.uk/environment/disposable-coffee-cups-how-big-problem-environment-landfill-recycling-incinerate-export-rubbish-a8142381.html

attributes.action: Allow students to have open book exams and supported with equations and formulae
attributes.background: more and more students are increasingly struggling to get a grip on the new GCSE format students are being made to memorise hundreds of different quotes from multiple books and poems
attributes.additional_details:
whilst also remembering key dates and theories in other subjects this is extremely challenging as it is becoming more about the memory skill rather than knowledge . furthermore a students are required to remember several different equations for subjects like maths and science this is beyond a students capacity and is overwhelming to the students health and well being . Anxiety and depression is most common amongst young people due to exam stress and revision . 
There needs to be a drastic change

attributes.action: Increase donations to food banks by forcing schools to give away uneaten food
attributes.background: In the UK, £13,000,000 of food is thrown away daily. This is unnecessary and wasteful. There are many people who are in great need of substantial meals and schools in particular could easily reduce their environmental impact and help those in need by donating to food banks at the end of each day.

attributes.action: Winter Tyres should be compulsory from October - April,
attributes.background: It's that time of year when temperatures start to plunge and drivers should be switching to winter tyres to avoid being caught out by snow and ice on the roads. Winter tyres can cut accidents and give you much better grip on the road even in wet condition
attributes.additional_details: There is a difference between summer and winter tyres. Winter tyres are made of a different rubber compound with a high silica content which makes them softer and tread pattern has small slits in the tread blocks so they grip the road better, and allow you to safely brake on snow and ice. Drivers are better off with winter tyres whenever the temperature dips below 7C. Cars with winter tyres have significantly shorter braking distances about 20 percent on wet surfaces a little longer on snow/ice

attributes.action: Introcude machines in the supermarkets to recycle pet bottles, cans and get paid
attributes.background: Encourage the government to install recyclable machines in the supermarkets to recycle pet bottles, cans and get paid in vouchers, this would encourage customers to recycle and get paid for that’s, that’s a win for win.
attributes.additional_details: In my recent trip to Germany I went to a supermarket and realised that they have machines installed across every single supermarket that’s encourages customers to recycle pet bottles and cans, furthermore they get vouchers from the supermarket that reduces their daily shopping costs by just recycling their cans and bottles. living in the uk, this is a must it’s win-win for both sides, customers bring the materials and get paid, the government reduced the plastic cost and reuses the old plastic.

attributes.action: Provide funding for school children to access leisure centres or gyms
attributes.background: Leisure centre memberships are expensive and many families cannot afford them. This is why I think pupils from primary to end of secondary schools should be provided with them. First to motivate more children to get into sports and to get fitter and to resolve Britain’s immense problem with obesity.
attributes.additional_details:
Did you know that in England the prevalence of overweight and obesity is above 70% among all age groups from 45 upwards.
 
For more information go visit https://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/SN03336/SN03336.pdf

attributes.action: Hold a new Brexit referendum at the next General Election if UK has not left EU
attributes.background: In the event that the UK has not yet left the EU by the time that the next General  Election is called, a new referendum on U.K. membership of the European Union (Brexit) should be held. Voting should take place at the same time as choosing a Member of Parliament, but with a separate ballot.
attributes.additional_details:
Brexit negotiations are causing instability in Parliament. The chances of a leadership challenge, or a vote of no confidence, are high. This could trigger a General Election.

If the British public are to be subjected to yet another General Election before we have formally left the EU, the opportunity should be taken to run a new, better “Brexit” referendum.

This will stop campaigning, and the outcome of an election, being misrepresented as a Brexit mandate, when it is in fact a vote for an MP.

attributes.action: Increase the Minimum wage for Under 18's, because it is too low to cover costs
attributes.background: The current UK minimum wage is £4.20. It violates rights for under 18's. And its harder for young adults to be able to save and invest. It creates boundaries. There are many costs which they cannot cover. Prices for food, drinks and clothes have gone up. So why cant the price of hourly wage go up.
attributes.additional_details: Currently most UK teenagers are being forced to work for £4.20 an hour. Some of those cannot provide enough to support their families. The cost for living has gone up. Its more expensive to live in this day and era. The price of a cup of coffee is £3.50. The price of daily necessities has increased rapidly. More and more families are becoming vulnerable, and parents of those young workers may not be able to provide for them. So they get a job. But £4.20 an hour is the price of peanuts.

attributes.action: Get crustaceans included under the Animal Welfare Act 2006.
attributes.background: Help us make the selling and cooking of live crustaceans (lobsters, crabs etc) illegal and get them included under the Animal Welfare Act 2006.
attributes.additional_details:
Our aim is to insure anyone farming, storing or slaughtering them must abide by animal welfare rules. Therefore, providing good water quality, enough food, humane slaughter and protection from pain.

There’s scientific evidence suggesting that crabs, lobsters, prawns and crayfish experience pain and emotion. Yet they are still sold, torn apart and boiled alive. Authorities were powerless to prosecute because these animals aren’t currently covered under animal welfare legislation.
